subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Stupid Radio Tricks-good refresher on oddities that must be separated from evp
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Yeah, there's somekind of propagation effect, but I've never thought of 
trying to record before the bands open. I've tried to record while the ham 
bands were open, and it didn't seem to make any difference. I have noticed 
though that when I first started using my boxes I was getting voices coming 
in like gangbusters as they say, but it tapered off to almost nothing by 
comparison, as did the ham bands with the solar cycle dropping. ( me's a 
extra class ham).

I have my new board all working up to the audio amps, there's seems to be an 
impedance mismatch between the tuner and the amplifiers. I'm working on a 
buffer to place in between them.

I made the sweep frequency adjustment a panel mount control, so it can be 
changed depending onthe band being used, and the conditions that are 
apparent by the way the voices come in.



Frank
